sourceMeaningMnemonic: On the bottom of <radical>bamboo</radical> <radical>root</radical>s there is a <radical>stamp</radical> that tells the <kanji>season</kanji> in which it was cut. We've been putting these season stamps on bamboo, and later pretty much every perishable food, for a long, long time.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself in a grocery store. You see a big pile of bamboo and pick each one up, checking the season stamps on their roots, to make sure you don't buy an old one.
readingMnemonic: These <kanji>season</kanji> stamps are marked on bamboo <reading>sets</reading> (<ja>せつ</ja>). You can't buy a single banana or a single grape, and just like that, if you want some nice seasonal bamboo, you have to buy them in sets.
readingInfo: How many bamboo sets will you be buying this season? I'm getting 42 sets.
